questions.question: What is the value of π (pi) rounded to two decimal places?
What is the Pythagorean theorem?
options: A² + B² = C²
A² - B² = C²
A² + B² = C
A³ + B³ = C³

questions.question: What does the term 'integral' refer to in calculus?
options: The rate of change of a function
The slope of a curve at a point
The area under a curve
The length of a curve

questions.question: What is the 'Fibonacci sequence'?
options: A sequence where each number is the sum of the two preceding ones, starting from 0 and 1
A sequence where each number is the product of the two preceding ones
A sequence of prime numbers
A sequence of even numbers
questions.correct_answer: A sequence where each number is the sum of the two preceding ones, starting from 0 and 1

questions.question: What is the 'Four Color Theorem' in mathematics?
options: A theorem stating that four colors are sufficient to color the regions of any map in such a way that no two adjacent regions have the same color
A theorem in linear algebra related to the four fundamental subspaces
A principle in geometry stating that four colors are needed to color any plane without overlapping
A hypothesis in number theory involving four different colors and their properties
questions.correct_answer: A theorem stating that four colors are sufficient to color the regions of any map in such a way that no two adjacent regions have the same color

questions.question: What is 'Gödel’s incompleteness theorem'?
options: A theorem that states every non-trivial computer program contains at least one bug
A theorem stating that within any given branch of mathematics, there are some propositions that can't be proved or disproved
A theorem that defines the solution to any algebraic equation
A theorem about the limits of proof and computation
questions.correct_answer: A theorem stating that within any given branch of mathematics, there are some propositions that can't be proved or disproved

questions.question: What is 'Banach-Tarski Paradox' in mathematics?
options: A paradox stating that it is possible to decompose a solid ball into a finite number of pieces and reassemble them into two solid balls, each the same size as the original
A theory in calculus describing the behavior of infinite series
A paradox in number theory related to the distribution of prime numbers
A principle in algebraic topology about the transformation of shapes
questions.correct_answer: A paradox stating that it is possible to decompose a solid ball into a finite number of pieces and reassemble them into two solid balls, each the same size as the original

questions.question: What is the 'Riemann Hypothesis'?
options: A hypothesis about the distribution of the zeros of the Riemann zeta function
A theory about the solution of non-linear equations
A hypothesis in statistical mechanics
A conjecture relating the prime numbers to the solution of differential equations
questions.correct_answer: A hypothesis about the distribution of the zeros of the Riemann zeta function

questions.question: What is 'Erdős number' in the context of mathematics?
options: A unique number assigned to every mathematician based on their collaborative distance from mathematician Paul Erdős
A number representing the complexity of a mathematical problem
A constant used in logarithmic calculations
A special type of prime number discovered by Paul Erdős
questions.correct_answer: A unique number assigned to every mathematician based on their collaborative distance from mathematician Paul Erdős

questions.question: What is the 'Langlands Program' in mathematics?
options: A computer program developed for solving complex algebraic equations
A set of conjectures and theorems about relationships between number theory and geometry
A program for calculating probabilities in quantum mechanics
A series of lectures by mathematician Robert Langlands
questions.correct_answer: A set of conjectures and theorems about relationships between number theory and geometry
